meanings.definition: Goods that are exported after being imported.
meanings.sent1: The reexports of electronics have increased this year.
meanings.sent2: The company specializes in reexports of luxury cars.
meanings.sent3: The reexports of rare spices made the market more flavorful.
meanings.sent4: Her suitcase was a treasure trove of reexports from her travels.
meanings.sent5: The warehouse was filled with valuable reexports waiting to be shipped.

meanings.definition: The act of exporting goods that were previously imported.
meanings.sent1: International trade relies on the smooth flow of reexports.
meanings.sent2: The country's economy benefits from the reexports of raw materials.
meanings.sent3: The reexports of antique furniture added a touch of history to the auction.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a clever reexports of famous quotes and anecdotes.
meanings.sent5: The success of the business was built on strategic reexports of products.
